Project Description:
Construction of a new WTP building with new filters, softeners, nitrate removal vessels, aerator, brine tank and chemical feed
systems, extend raw watermain and construct finished watermain.
Well #2 improvements.
Construction of a new well and associated piping.

Construction of approximately 3 miles of 3" and 4" waterlines with valves, hydrants and other appurtenances. Installation of a booster pump station with 2 master meters to serve as an interconnection between South Lawrence Water Corporation, the City of St. Francisville and the City of Bridgeport. Complete replacement of Booster Pump Station #1 and replacment of pumps in Booster Pump Station #2.
Installation of new water meters in dwellings and existing meter pits. Replacement of water service lines, valves and fire hydrants. Installation of new Well #4 and abandon Well #1 Install.
Construction of 42" and 36" transmission main from Wheeler Drive to Booster Station No. 2.
Expansion of the existing well house to accommodate the addition of an Iron/Manganese filtration system.
Replacement of 20,000 LF of watermains and fire hydrants.
Update, refurbish and replace internal and external components of the water vertical pressure filter system.
Watermain improvements.
Replacement and installation of new watermain, hydrants, valves, water services, and trench restoration.
Phase 2 - Replacement of 5,500 LF of watermain and rehab 2 existing water towers.
Construction of a new well; and construction of a new a water tower to eliminate the current pressure tank and air compressor system.
Replacement of 23,750 LF of watermain.
Replacement of 6" watermain with 8" watermain, replacement of vales and watermain connections.
Replacement of 6" watermain with 8" watermain, replacement of vales and watermain connections.

Phase 1 - Replacement of the 50,000 gal. multi-legged steel elevated storage tank with a new 50,000 gal. pedestal tank.
Abandonment of Well #2 and demolition of existing water treatment plant clearwell and high service pump building.
Construction of a new water facilities building, approximately 1,800 square feet.

Coating the elevated storage tank and detention tank, replacement of media in the iron filters and rebuilding the red-water filter at
the water treatment plant.

The proposed project involves the replacement of various electrical systems within the Lakeview Punp Station. Specific activities
include the replacement of the two motor control centers, two duplex pumps, and improvements to the HVAC system.
Replacement of 450 water meters and a new radio read system.
Phase 2 - Construction of an 150,000 gal. pedesphere water storage tank.

Replacement of existing high service pumps and generator. NEC Code compliance improvements. Installation of new watermain,
chlorination system, back-up power system, security cameras and perimeter fence. Aeration treatment unit, ground storage and
pressure filter improvements.
Water System Improvements - Interconnection with Southwater

Replacement of approximately 7.5 miles of 16" raw water main, and installation of a new watermain and master meter vault for a
connection to the Village of Coulterville.
Connection of watermain between existing CTPWD water distribution system and existing Valley View Subdivision water distribution system.
Replacement of the 150,000 gal. elevated water tank with a new 500,000 gal. elevated water tank.
Rehabilitation and flood proof water treatment plant raw water and high service pump station.
Replacement of underground pressure adjusting station with an above grade pressure adjusting station.
Phase 3 - Replacement of approximately 9,600' of watermain with 6" watermain, valves, and hydrants.
Removal and replacement of approximately 1,200 meters
Installation of 6" watermains to replace undersized watermains.
Construction of a new master meter station with improvements to chlorine storage, controls and equipment. Replacement of 6" watermain, valves, hydrants, service lines and water meters.
Phase 3 - Replacement of 2,000 LF of watermain.
Construction of approximately 5,700 LF of 16" watermain, portions of which will be directionally drilled under wetlands.
Phase 3 - Construction of approximately 4,020' of 6" and 8" watermain.
Phase 1 - Proposed Booster Pumping Station, two pressure reducing stations and approximately 15,000 LF of 8" watermain extension.
Blast and repaint the interior and exterior of the Elevated Storage Tank.
Drill and construct of new Well #8.
Coating, structure and safety improvements to both elevated water storage tanks.
Construction of a new water treatment plant, intake structure and approximately 10,000 LF of raw and finished watermain.
Installation of approximately 2,200 new water meters, and meter reading system.

Construction of a proposed water building addition, removal and replacement of the existing pressurized vessel filter tanks, addition of a new reverse osmosis filtration system with control panel, removal of the existing aerator and reaction basin, replacement of the existing backwash filter media, a new backup generator and new aerator. Parking lot improvements around the building and placement of insertion valves throughout the distribution system.
Replace 3,000 LF of watermain and SCADA system. Install gate valves and flushing hydrants.
Phase 3 - Replacement of watermains.
Construction of a new 495 gpm Well and well house, access road and watermain connection.
Replace 2,000' of existing watermain and install 700' of 8" watermain to create a looping system.

Construction of a new 6.0 MGD water treatment plant with a new 24" raw water main from the existing water treatment plant to the new plant and new finished watermains from the new plant to the existing water distribution system.
Replacement of 4" and 6" watermains, valves and fire hydrants and complete some watermain looping in the system.
Replacement of watermains, valves and fire hydrants.
Phase IV - Replacement of watermains and water meters and replacement of raw watermains that are exposed in dry creek beds.
Replacement of watermains.
